repositories.brief_summary: New PR for license field in opam list and discussion about improving tag visibility
repositories.activity_summary: New PR adding license field to opam list command and issue proposing tag improvements
repositories.activity: - [Raphaël Proust](https://github.com/raphael-proust) opened **new PR** to add `license` as a possible field for `opam list` command ([#6841](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6841)), received **code review feedback** from [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) suggesting use of `assoc_opt` and requesting tests, with author adding test file after initial review
repositories.discussions_summary: Proposal to improve tag visibility and discoverability in opam ecosystem
repositories.notable_discussions: - [@jrfondren](https://github.com/jrfondren) opened detailed **issue about tag visibility** noting that `dune init proj` suggests using tags but it's difficult to explore existing tags ([#6842](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6842)), providing comprehensive analysis showing 126 packages use `org:mirage` tag, 61 use `org:xapi-project`, and 729 singleton tags exist (some with errors like `arrays,` with comma), proposing improvements including **tag cloud**, dedicated tag search (separate from string search), and `--columns` option to show tags in `opam list`
repositories.contributors_summary: Three contributors active with PR development, code review, and feature proposals
repositories.contributors:
- [Raphaël Proust](https://github.com/raphael-proust) authored PR adding license field support to `opam list` command ([#6841](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6841)) and incorporated review feedback by adding test file
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) provided **code review** on license field PR suggesting use of `assoc_opt` and requesting tests ([#6841](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6841))
- [@jrfondren](https://github.com/jrfondren) authored detailed issue analyzing tag usage across opam packages with script to count tag occurrences and proposing UI improvements ([#6842](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6842))

repositories.activity_summary: Automated PR opened to update Nix flake dependencies including merlin and nixpkgs

repositories.brief_summary: Test coverage expansion with reproduction cases added for four historical bug reports
repositories.activity_summary: Four test case PRs opened for bug reproduction, with one PR showing Windows CI path handling discussion
repositories.activity:
- [Charlène_Gros](https://github.com/Lucccyo) opened three **test reproduction PRs** this week: [#2022](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2022) for [#1214](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1214) and [#2021](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2021) for [#1763](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1763) both indicate bugs appear resolved as errors no longer reproduce, while [#2020](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2020) successfully reproduces the behavior reported in [#1987](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1987)
- **Windows CI path handling** discussion emerged in [#2017](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2017) where [Charlène_Gros](https://github.com/Lucccyo) seeks input from [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) and [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw) regarding path style differences between Linux and Windows causing test failures, with proposed solution to filter output using `jq .pos` to handle absolute versus relative path differences
repositories.discussions_summary: Windows CI discussion addresses path handling differences affecting test output validation
repositories.notable_discussions: - **Windows CI path handling** raised in [#2017](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2017) where test failures occur due to different path styles between Linux (using `$TESTCASE_ROOT/test.ml`) and Windows (using absolute paths like `D:\a\merlin\merlin\_build\.sandbox\...\test.ml`), with [Charlène_Gros](https://github.com/Lucccyo) proposing to filter test output to compare only position information rather than full paths
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on test infrastructure improvements through systematic bug reproduction efforts
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Test coverage expansion** through systematic reproduction of historical bug reports, with [Charlène_Gros](https://github.com/Lucccyo) methodically adding test cases for issues [#1214](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1214), [#1763](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1763), [#1980](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1980), and [#1987](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1987) to verify current behavior and prevent regressions
- **Cross-platform testing** attention as Windows CI infrastructure reveals path handling differences that require platform-specific test output normalization strategies
repositories.contributors_summary: Charlène_Gros opened four test reproduction PRs and engaged in Windows CI discussion
repositories.contributors: - [Charlène_Gros](https://github.com/Lucccyo) from Tarides opened four test case PRs ([#2020](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2020), [#2021](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2021), [#2022](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2022), and [#2017](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2017)) adding reproduction cases for historical bugs and identified Windows CI path handling issues requiring feedback from [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) and [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw)

repositories.brief_summary: Exceptional week with 110 PRs merged, resolving long-standing include_subdirs qualified issues and advancing tracing infrastructure
repositories.new_features_summary: Dynamic modules expansion for parser generators, enhanced tracing with follow mode, cram test timing, package enabled_if support
repositories.new_features:
- **Dynamic `(modules ..)` expansion** for parser generators (ocamllex, ocamlyacc, menhir) supporting special forms like `(:include ..)` and `%{read-lines:..}` by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) ([#13105](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13105), [#13135](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13135), [#13157](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13157))
- **Sandboxed ocamllex and ocamlyacc** actions for improved build isolation ([#13098](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13098))
- **Cram test command timing** providing performance metrics for every command executed in cram tests by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) ([#13092](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13092))
- **Trace follow mode** with `$ dune trace cat --follow` enabling real-time trace monitoring ([#13133](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13133))
- **Signal tracing events** added to trace output for debugging signal handling ([#13193](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13193))
- **Canonical s-expression trace format** improving performance and consistency, supporting `--chrome-trace` for perfetto and `--sexp` for interactive usage ([#13059](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13059))
- **Package-level `enabled_if` field** in dune-project files allowing conditional package masking with conversion to opam `available` expressions (unreleased feature requiring Dune 3.22+) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) ([#12905](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12905))
- Fixed **menhir parser compilation** in subdirectories with `(include_subdirs qualified)` ([#13118](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13118), fixes [#11119](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11119))
- Fixed **`(select ..)` field handling** with `(include_subdirs ..)` parsing paths relative to module group root ([#13175](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13175), fixes [#4383](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/4383), [#12450](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12450))
- Fixed **delayed module path evaluation** for include_subdirs qualified ([#13156](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13156), fixes [#7628](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/7628), [#7605](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/7605))
- Improved **include_subdirs documentation** with comprehensive usage examples and troubleshooting ([#13200](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13200))
repositories.activity_summary: Ten new PRs opened including vendoring utility, cross-compilation support, and git pinning improvements alongside scheduler refactoring
repositories.activity:
- Ten **new PRs opened** this week including OCaml vendoring utility by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) ([#13097](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13097)), cross-compilation `--target-exec` implementation by [Romain Beauxis](https://github.com/toots) ([#13112](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13112)), git repository pinning improvements by [Marek Kubica](https://github.com/Leonidas-from-XIV) ([#13176](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13176)), dune init src directory default by [Etienne](https://github.com/maiste) ([#13192](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13192)), vendoring test for data-only directories by [Sudha Parimala](https://github.com/Sudha247) ([#13129](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13129)), dune-site linkall warning by [Raphaël Proust](https://github.com/raphael-proust) ([#13109](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13109)), CI opam dependency caching by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) ([#13177](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13177)), and trace commands enhancement by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) ([#13183](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13183))
- **Include_subdirs qualified improvements** with 57 PRs merged by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) addressing parser generators (menhir, ocamllex, ocamlyacc) with dynamic module expansion, select field fixes, module path evaluation improvements, and comprehensive test coverage ([#13105](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13105), [#13118](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13118), [#13135](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13135), [#13156](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13156), [#13157](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13157), [#13160](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13160), [#13167](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13167), [#13175](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13175), [#13185](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13185), [#13187](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13187), [#13189](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13189), [#13195](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13195), [#13198](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13198))
- **Dune scheduler refactoring** by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) extracting scheduler into dedicated library with nine modularization PRs improving code organization ([#13191](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13191), [#13207](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13207), [#13208](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13208), [#13209](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13209), [#13210](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13210), [#13211](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13211), [#13212](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13212), [#13213](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13213), [#13214](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13214))
- **Tracing infrastructure enhancements** with atomic event writing ([#13116](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13116)), thread safety improvements ([#13151](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13151)), signal tracking ([#13193](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13193)), cram test event naming ([#13197](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13197)), and jq function for analyzing slow commands ([#13203](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13203))
- **Cram test bash integration** completed with bash shell support ([#13137](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13137)), safety options including errexit and pipefail ([#13132](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13132)), undefined variable detection ([#13161](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13161)), bash script syntax checking ([#13186](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13186)), improved unreachable output extraction ([#13164](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13164)), and evaluation fixes ([#13150](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13150))
- **Package management work** with nested dune executable resolution fix closing 2-year-old issue ([#12902](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12902), fixes [#10019](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/10019)), pinning function renaming for clarity ([#13178](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13178)), pin stanza behavior documentation ([#13106](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13106), [#13126](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13126), [#13127](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13127)), and active discussions on git pinning ([#13176](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13176)) and vendoring utility ([#13097](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13097))
- **CI and test infrastructure** improvements by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) including multi-repo-build depext auto-installation ([#13111](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13111)), display configuration ([#13124](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13124)), configurable steps ([#13125](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13125)), unique cache prefix enforcement ([#13091](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13091)), opam cache optimization ([#13115](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13115)), building `@install` instead of `@all` in tests ([#13206](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13206)), and removing `--display short` from odoc tests ([#13204](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13204))
- **Test coverage expansion** with directory target special files handling ([#13179](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13179), [#13180](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13180)), bytecode inline tests ([#13199](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13199)), executable name collision tests ([#13122](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13122)), and comprehensive test suite for include_subdirs scenarios
- **Long-standing issues resolved** including 7-year-old issue about runtest module selection ([#870](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/870) via [#13064](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13064)), 6-year-old single inline test running issue ([#4873](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/4873)), multiple 5-year-old include_subdirs bugs ([#4381](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/4381), [#4383](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/4383)), and 4-year-old data_only_dirs feature request ([#7628](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/7628))
- Documentation additions including dune_cmd testing utility information ([#13104](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13104)) and dev pinning purpose clarification ([#13126](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13126))
repositories.discussions_summary: Active debate on executable organization documentation and design discussions for vendoring utility and git pinning improvements
repositories.notable_discussions:
- Documentation **philosophy debate** on organizing executables with 29 comments by [@jrfondren](https://github.com/jrfondren) discussing dune init defaults and project layout conventions ([#13142](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13142))
- **Vendoring utility** design discussions with 20 comments by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) covering implementation approach for OCaml package vendoring ([#13097](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13097))
- **Git repository pinning** enhancement with 18 comments by [Marek Kubica](https://github.com/Leonidas-from-XIV) proposing git_repo usage for package pinning ([#13176](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13176))
- **Select field fix** with 18 comments by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) addressing path handling with include_subdirs through thorough review process ([#13175](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13175))
- **Trace atomic writes** implementation discussion with 14 comments by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) covering technical details of event writing improvements ([#13116](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13116))
- **Trace follow mode** feature discussion with 12 comments by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) regarding real-time trace monitoring capabilities ([#13133](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13133))
repositories.trends_summary: Focused effort on include_subdirs qualified maturity, infrastructure investments in tracing and testing, and package management modernization
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Include_subdirs qualified reaching production maturity** with resolution of multiple long-standing issues spanning 5+ years ([#4381](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/4381), [#4383](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/4383), [#7628](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/7628), [#11119](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11119), [#12450](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12450))
- **Observability focus** with comprehensive tracing enhancements including performance analysis tools, real-time monitoring, and command timing providing deeper build insights ([#13059](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13059), [#13092](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13092), [#13116](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13116), [#13133](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13133), [#13193](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13193), [#13203](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13203))
- **Package management evolution** toward modern workflows with vendoring utility development, improved git pinning, and lock file enhancements reflecting ecosystem needs ([#13097](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13097), [#13108](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13108), [#13110](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13110), [#13130](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13130), [#13176](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13176))
- **Code health initiatives** including scheduler modularization into dedicated library ([#13191](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13191)), test infrastructure improvements, and technical debt reduction closing decade-old issues ([#870](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/870))
- **Bash integration for testing** establishing comprehensive cram test support with safety features, syntax checking, and proper bash semantics ([#13132](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13132), [#13137](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13137), [#13186](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13186))
- **Performance analysis tooling** with slow test identification ([#13202](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13202)), command timing data ([#13092](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13092)), and jq-based analysis functions ([#13203](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13203)) enabling data-driven optimization
repositories.issues_summary: Documentation task for organizing multiple executables across directories with shared library code
repositories.good_first_issues: - Create **howto guide** for organizing multiple executables in different directories covering dune file structure, subdirectory patterns, and sharing library code between executables by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) ([#13181](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13181))
repositories.contributors_summary: Antonio Nuno Monteiro led with 57 PRs on include_subdirs, Rudi Grinberg contributed 36 PRs on tracing and scheduler refactoring

repositories.brief_summary: Documentation updates removing DkML instructions and infrastructure improvements to HTTP scraping tools
repositories.new_features_summary: Removed DkML Windows installation instructions, improved scraping infrastructure with User-Agent headers and rate limiting
repositories.new_features:
- **Windows installation documentation** streamlined by removing deprecated DkML instructions following its sunsetting announcement, simplifying the Windows setup guide to focus on opam, Docker, and WSL2 ([#3425](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3425))
- **HTTP client improvements** for scraping infrastructure including User-Agent header added to prevent blocking and optional random delay parameter to avoid rate limiting ([#3434](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3434), [#3435](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3435))
- **YouTube scraping enhancements** with randomized source processing order and configurable delay (up to 180 seconds) between requests to prevent blocking ([#3435](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3435))
- **Workflow dependency updates** with GitHub Actions peter-evans/create-pull-request bumped from version 7 to 8 for Node 24 support ([#3418](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3418))
repositories.activity_summary: Tutorial internationalization work ongoing while automated content scraping merged new blog posts and videos
repositories.activity:
- **Tutorial internationalization** draft PR by [mt_caret](https://github.com/mt-caret) continues with initial framework for I18n of tutorial documentation affecting 77 files ([#3238](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3238))
- **Automated content updates** merged throughout the week with new OCaml blog posts and videos scraped including the OCaml Weekly News from December 30 and a blog post about multi-domain OCaml on Raspberry Pi Pico 2 microcontroller ([#3439](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3439), [#3438](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3438), [#3436](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3436), [#3431](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3431))
repositories.discussions_summary: Investigation of documentation build failures affecting packages released since November 2025
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Documentation generation failure** reported by [Julien Debon](https://github.com/sir4ur0n) affecting QCheck 0.90/0.91 and other packages published since late November, with [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) investigating and identifying the root cause as `OpamStd.String.starts_with` removal in opam 2.5.0 breaking the opamh tool used by voodoo documentation builder ([#3437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3437))
- **Devcontainer build issues** discussed by [Sacha Ayoun](https://github.com/giltho) regarding outdated Dockerfile leading to incompatible versions of lsp and yojson libraries, with ongoing investigation into why this doesn't affect CI or other developers ([#3304](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3304))
repositories.trends_summary: Infrastructure reliability improvements and documentation maintenance alongside content aggregation automation
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Infrastructure robustness** focus with improvements to HTTP scraping tools to handle rate limiting and blocking through User-Agent headers, randomization, and delays preventing service disruptions ([#3434](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3434), [#3435](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3435))
- **Documentation toolchain maintenance** needs highlighted by systematic failures in documentation generation for recent package releases, revealing dependency on external tools that broke with opam 2.5.0 release ([#3437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3437))
- **Platform simplification** evident in removal of DkML installation instructions, consolidating Windows installation options following the sunsetting of that distribution ([#3425](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3425))
repositories.contributors_summary: Contributions from Cuihtlauac Alvarado on scraping infrastructure, Jonah Beckford on documentation cleanup, and Jan Midtgaard investigating build failures
repositories.contributors:
- [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) improved the HTTP scraping infrastructure by adding User-Agent headers to prevent blocking ([#3434](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3434)) and implementing rate limiting with randomization for YouTube scraping ([#3435](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3435))
- [@jonahbeckford](https://github.com/jonahbeckford) removed DkML installation instructions from the Windows documentation following the distribution's sunsetting announcement ([#3425](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3425))
- [mt_caret](https://github.com/mt-caret) continues work on tutorial internationalization framework affecting 77 files in the ongoing draft PR ([#3238](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3238))
- [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) investigated documentation generation failures, identified the root cause in opamh tool compatibility with opam 2.5.0, and opened a fix PR in the upstream repository ([#3437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3437))
- [Julien Debon](https://github.com/sir4ur0n) reported missing documentation for QCheck 0.90/0.91 releases, initiating investigation into systematic documentation build failures ([#3437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3437))
- [Sacha Ayoun](https://github.com/giltho) reported devcontainer build failures with incompatible library versions and participated in troubleshooting discussions ([#3304](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3304))
- Automated scraping workflows merged multiple content updates throughout the week bringing new blog posts and videos to the site ([#3439](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3439), [#3438](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3438), [#3436](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3436), [#3431](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3431))

repositories.brief_summary: Cryptokit 1.21.1 adds elliptic curves and Paillier encryption; 21 packages merged including new Neo4j client and music manager
repositories.new_features_summary: New packages: Neo4j client with TLS, Intel HEX library, music manager; Cryptokit adds elliptic curves and homomorphic encryption
repositories.new_features:
- **Cryptokit 1.21.1** by [Xavier Leroy](https://github.com/xavierleroy) adds Paillier homomorphic public-key encryption, elliptic-curve cryptography (ECDSA, ECDH), SHA512/256 and SHA512/224 hash functions, and key derivation functions; introduces breaking change with distinct RSA types for public/private keys ([#29162](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29162))
- **neo4j_bolt 0.3.0** by [Jeong-Sik Yun](https://github.com/jeong-sik) introduces TLS/SSL support with `bolt+s://`, `bolts://`, and `bolt+ssc://` URI schemes, plus URI-based connection configuration ([#29175](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29175))
- **shakuhachi 0.1.0** by [@EruEri](https://github.com/EruEri) provides music collection management and tagging capabilities ([#29136](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29136))
- **polymarket 0.2.0** by [Richard Haut](https://github.com/Haut) offers OCaml client for Polymarket prediction market API ([#29164](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29164))
- **intel_hex 0.1** by [Михаил](https://github.com/dx3mod) provides Intel HEX file manipulation for embedded systems ([#29180](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29180))
- **restricted 1.1** by [@stopusingghpls](https://github.com/stopusingghpls) enables restricting system operations and filesystem view, implementing OpenBSD-style security controls ([#29182](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29182))
- **reason-react-day-picker 0.1** by [Brian Kaplan](https://github.com/brianwk) adds Melange bindings for react-day-picker in ReasonML ([#29172](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29172))
- **raylib-callbacks 1.6.0** by [Tobias Mock](https://github.com/tjammer) introduces callback APIs for raylib with ctypes-foreign dependency, exposing ModelAnimation.t name field ([#29008](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29008))
- **ocamlformat-mlx 0.28.1.1** by [@mlx-automation](https://github.com/mlx-automation) updates Odoc parser to 3.0, adds letop-punning option and unnamed functor parameter support, sets OCaml 5.4 as default version ([#29169](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29169))
- **jupyter 3.0.1** by [Eugene Lykhovyd](https://github.com/zhelih) brings OCaml 5 support with legitimate maintainer handover from akabe ([#29142](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29142))
- **rpclib 10.0.0** by [Pau Ruiz Safont](https://github.com/psafont) adds Python 3 support, drops Python 2, removes deprecated rpc virtual package, and makes rpclib-async OCaml 5.3+ only while other libraries support 4.14+ ([#29075](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29075))
- **simple_httpd 1.0** by [Christophe Raffalli](https://github.com/craff) fixes bugs related to bytecode and 32-bit architectures, reaching first stable release ([#29154](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29154))
- **menhir-lsp 0.1.2** by [@dalps](https://github.com/dalps) fixes completion entries not showing due to special characters, reduces verbose document symbols, and improves documentation messages ([#29151](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29151))
- **reason-react 0.17.0** by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) upgrades ppxlib lower bound to 0.36 ([#29132](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29132))
repositories.activity_summary: Eight new PRs opened including FFmpeg 1.2.8, POSIX 4.0.0, and LLVM 20/21; ongoing work addresses dependency constraints and platform compatibility
repositories.activity:
- **Eight new PRs opened** this week include FFmpeg 1.2.8 bindings ([#29163](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29163)) by [Romain Beauxis](https://github.com/toots) with platform constraints being refined, POSIX 4.0.0 with 14 packages ([#29165](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29165)) by [Romain Beauxis](https://github.com/toots) iterating on FreeBSD compatibility, simple_httpd 1.0.1 ([#29174](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29174)) by [Christophe Raffalli](https://github.com/craff) fixing SSE test timing, LLVM 20 and 21 ([#29110](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29110)) by [Alan](https://github.com/alan-j-hu), metadata 0.3.2 ([#29183](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29183)) by [Romain Beauxis](https://github.com/toots), rizzo 0.3.0 FRP library ([#29181](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29181)) by [@tjobi](https://github.com/tjobi) fixing heap garbage collection bug, ortools 9.14.0 ([#29159](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29159)) by [Timothy Bourke](https://github.com/tbrk) investigating build options for Google OR-Tools dependency, and memcpy 0.3.0 ([#29144](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29144)) by [Jeremy Yallop](https://github.com/yallop) addressing Windows CI failures
- **Dependency constraint management** saw extensive work with [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) adding missing ppxlib upper bounds in reason-react-ppx 0.13.0 and 0.14.0 ([#29177](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29177)), [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) adding more reason-react-ppx upper bounds ([#29178](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29178)) and constraining gapi-ocaml to cryptokit < 1.21 ([#29168](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29168)) due to breaking RSA type changes, and [Raphaël Proust](https://github.com/raphael-proust) fixing otel-cohttp-lwt compatibility with cohttp 6.2.0 ([#29157](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29157))
- **Platform-specific compatibility fixes** delivered by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) adding zlib-dev dependency for conf-taglib_c.2 on Alpine ([#29161](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29161)), [Romain Beauxis](https://github.com/toots) addressing FreeBSD _PC_2_SYMLINKS issues in POSIX bindings and adding platform failure acceptance for FFmpeg on debian-11, opensuse-15.6, and ubuntu-22.04, and [Raphaël Proust](https://github.com/raphael-proust) fixing kinetic-client.0.0.1 build failures ([#29156](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29156)) and cca packages ([#29155](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29155))
- **Withdrawn PRs** include lwt 6.0.0 ([#29147](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29147)) by [Raphaël Proust](https://github.com/raphael-proust) due to cohttp-server-lwt-unix and inotify failures with plans to re-release with non-breaking socket option changes, Cryptokit 1.21 ([#29148](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29148)) superseded by 1.21.1 to fix endian-dependent SHA512/224 bug on s390x, and POSIX 3.1.0 ([#29128](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29128)) by [Romain Beauxis](https://github.com/toots) withdrawn to disable tests and implement larger changes, resulting in 4.0.0 submission
- **Additional package updates** merged include smtml 0.18.0 SMT solver frontend ([#29143](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29143)) by [@filipeom](https://github.com/filipeom), alice 0.3.0 ([#29145](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29145)) by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) correcting archive URL, gapi-ocaml 0.4.8 ([#29176](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29176)) by [Alessandro Strada](https://github.com/astrada), and shellwords 1.0.0 ([#29126](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29126)) by [Daniel Fichtinger](https://github.com/ficd0) providing POSIX shell command parsing matching Rust shell-words crate behavior
repositories.discussions_summary: Community debate on CI testing philosophy proposes tiered test approach with dune aliases for unit, network, end-to-end, and fuzztests
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **CI testing philosophy** sparked debate in [#29166](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29166) where [Romain Beauxis](https://github.com/toots) requested stopping `dune runtest` in opam-repo CI, arguing it creates anti-patterns where maintainers avoid dune testing framework; [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) countered that ecosystem-level integration tests catch regressions constantly and provide reverse dependency validation; [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) proposed standardizing test aliases in dune for different test types (unit, network/storage, end-to-end, benchmarks, fuzztests) as part of a three-tiered approach
- **Archiving policy clarification** requested in [#29106](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29106) by [Martin Jambon](https://github.com/mjambon) about defining "archiving" and "maintaining" in x-maintenance-intent field; [@filipeom](https://github.com/filipeom) explained that archiving means moved to opam-repository-archive and no longer available through default remote, with criteria requiring package must be buildable, maintained, or depended upon
- **Windows CI behavior** issue raised in [#29158](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29158) by [Raphaël Proust](https://github.com/raphael-proust) noting Windows actions build avoid-version packages unlike occurent-based CI
- **FreeBSD conf-mesa breakage** reported in [#29152](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29152) by [Tobias Mock](https://github.com/tjammer) where conf-mesa.1 fails on FreeBSD with pkg-config gl errors, though it worked on FreeBSD 12
- **Maintainer transition discussion** around jupyter 3.0.1 ([#29142](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29142)) demonstrated proper handover process from akabe to [Eugene Lykhovyd](https://github.com/zhelih), providing model for legitimate maintainer transitions
repositories.trends_summary: OCaml 5.x support becoming standard, careful breaking change management, platform compatibility focus on Alpine/FreeBSD/Windows
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **OCaml 5.x adoption accelerating** with jupyter 3.0.1 ([#29142](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29142)) adding OCaml 5 support, rpclib-async 10.0.0 ([#29075](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29075)) requiring OCaml 5.3+, and ocamlformat-mlx 0.28.1.1 ([#29169](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29169)) setting OCaml 5.4 as default version
- **Breaking changes managed carefully** through ecosystem coordination, demonstrated by Cryptokit 1.21.1 RSA type split ([#29162](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29162)) requiring gapi-ocaml constraint update ([#29168](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29168)), and lwt 6.0.0 ([#29147](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29147)) being withdrawn to rework socket option changes that caused cohttp and inotify failures
- **Platform-specific compatibility** receiving attention across Alpine/musl with zlib dependency fixes ([#29161](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29161)), FreeBSD with _PC_2_SYMLINKS issues ([#29165](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29165)) and conf-mesa breakage ([#29152](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29152)), Windows CI challenges with avoid-version packages ([#29158](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29158)) and memcpy failures ([#29144](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29144)), and s390x endianness in Cryptokit ([#29148](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29148))
- **Ecosystem diversity expanding** with new packages spanning embedded systems (intel_hex [#29180](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29180)), database clients (neo4j_bolt [#29175](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29175)), music management (shakuhachi [#29136](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29136)), prediction markets (polymarket [#29164](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29164)), and security (restricted [#29182](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29182))
- **Test infrastructure evolving** with discussion around separating unit tests from integration tests ([#29166](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29166)), proposal for standardized dune test aliases, and decisions to disable tests in POSIX 4.0.0 ([#29165](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29165)) compared to 3.1.0 ([#29128](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29128))
- **Dependency constraint precision improving** through proactive upper bound additions for ppxlib in reason-react-ppx ([#29177](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29177), [#29178](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29178)), cryptokit in gapi-ocaml ([#29168](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29168)), and cohttp in otel-cohttp-lwt ([#29157](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29157))
