repositories.brief_summary: Dissector pass for linking large executables merged, arm64 work progressing, modes system improvements underway
repositories.new_features_summary: Dissector pass with new CLI flags, debug tracking improvements for name mangling, type inspection infrastructure
repositories.new_features:
- **Dissector pass** for linking large executables (>2GB) using small code model without text section changes, enabled via `-dissector` flag with partition size control via `-dissector-partition-size` and debug flags `-ddissector`, `-ddissector-sizes`, `-ddissector-verbose`, `-ddissector-partitions`, and `-ddissector-inputs` by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) ([#5146](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5146))
- **Debug tracking improvements** for name mangling with new `enter_anonymous_module` function and location tracking in `enter_anonymous_function` by [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) ([#5098](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5098))
- **Type inspection infrastructure** with `Texp_inspected_type` and `Tpat_inspected_type` nodes for passing disambiguation information in quotes by [Jakub Bachurski](https://github.com/jbachurski) ([#5090](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5090))
- **Arm64 AST reorganization** moving arm64 AST into dedicated library in `backend/arm64/ast/` to support upcoming binary emitter by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) ([#5184](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5184))
- **OCamlformat preparation** with formatting fixes to support upgrade to version 0.28.1 by [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) ([#5181](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5181), [#5189](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5189))
repositories.activity_summary: 17 new PRs opened including arm64 DSL, modes improvements, and tooling updates; arm64 and modes work progressing
repositories.activity:
- **New PRs opened** this week include Nix flake update for OCaml 5.4 by [Jacob Van Buren](https://github.com/jvanburen) ([#5194](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5194)), modality hints by [Zesen Qian](https://github.com/riaqn) ([#5183](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5183)), scannable axis modifiers by [Ryan Tjoa](https://github.com/rtjoa) ([#5187](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5187)), ocamlformat upgrade by [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) ([#5180](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5180)), and multiple arm64 infrastructure PRs by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) including typed DSL ([#5193](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5193)), logical immediate refactoring ([#5192](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5192)), and platform-independent ocaml-jit ([#5186](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5186))
- **Arm64 binary emitter work** progressing with infrastructure improvements including typed DSL rewrite ([#5193](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5193)), improved label/symbol typing in Asm_directives ([#5185](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5185)), extra owee functionality ([#5188](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5188)), and binary emitter itself in draft form ([#5177](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5177))
- **Modes system refinements** with [Zesen Qian](https://github.com/riaqn) working on modality hints ([#5183](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5183)), explicit val_modalities application ([#5190](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5190)), and module mode hints ([#5034](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5034)), while [Ryan Tjoa](https://github.com/rtjoa) addresses scannable axes behavior ([#5187](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5187), [#5169](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5169)) and or_null layout precision ([#5176](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5176), [#5178](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5178))
- **Zero-alloc checker improvements** by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) preventing Widen exception escapes ([#5179](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5179)) and synchronizing destruction point checks ([#5182](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5182))
- **Dissector refinements** following merge with stack overflow fix ([#5191](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5191)) and test simplification ([#5195](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5195)) by [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) and [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell)
- **Metaprogramming features** advancing with quote disambiguation work by [Jakub Bachurski](https://github.com/jbachurski) for records/variants ([#5094](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5094)) and polymorphic applications ([#5154](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5154))
- **OCaml 5.4 upgrade** preparations continuing by [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) with ocamlformat version bump ([#5180](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5180)) as part of broader upgrade effort ([#5036](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5036))
repositories.discussions_summary: Ikinds design discussion ongoing, arm64 binary emitter architecture being refined, preemption implementation review
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Ikinds representation** discussion by [@julesjacobs](https://github.com/julesjacobs) exploring minus24 encoding with over 160 comments addressing layout computation, mutual recursion handling, and integration strategy ([#5159](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5159))
- **Arm64 binary emitter architecture** refinement by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) discussing verification flags, improved typing for labels/symbols, and integration with ocaml-jit for metaprogramming support ([#5177](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5177))
- **Scannable axes semantics** debate between [Ryan Tjoa](https://github.com/rtjoa) and reviewers regarding backwards compatibility for `mod` syntax behavior with non_float and nullability modifiers, balancing immediate needs against future ppx_template improvements ([#5187](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5187))
- **Or_null layout precision** technical discussion by [Ryan Tjoa](https://github.com/rtjoa) examining separability computation edge cases and dead code identification in type_jkind ([#5178](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5178))
- **Preemption implementation** review by [Aspen Smith](https://github.com/glittershark) with detailed feedback on SSE register handling in garbage collection interface ([#5136](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5136), [#4881](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4881))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on arm64 platform support, refinement of modes/modalities system, tooling modernization
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Arm64 platform maturation** with comprehensive work spanning typed DSL rewrite, binary emitter implementation, platform-independent JIT support, and improved label/symbol typing across 7+ PRs by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) ([#5193](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5193), [#5192](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5192), [#5191](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5191), [#5188](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5188), [#5186](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5186), [#5185](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5185), [#5184](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5184), [#5177](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5177))
- **Modes system refinement** through multiple coordinated PRs addressing modality hints, val_modalities application, scannable axes semantics, and or_null precision by [Zesen Qian](https://github.com/riaqn) and [Ryan Tjoa](https://github.com/rtjoa) ([#5183](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5183), [#5190](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5190), [#5187](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5187), [#5176](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5176), [#5178](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5178), [#5169](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5169), [#5034](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5034))
- **Tooling modernization** with OCaml 5.4 upgrade preparations including ocamlformat 0.28.1 bump and Nix flake updates ([#5180](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5180), [#5194](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5194), [#5036](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5036))
- **Metaprogramming infrastructure** development with type inspection framework and quote disambiguation features by [Jakub Bachurski](https://github.com/jbachurski) ([#5090](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5090), [#5094](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5094), [#5154](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5154))
- **Large-scale compilation support** with dissector pass enabling 2GB+ executables using small code model without recompilation by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) ([#5146](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5146))
repositories.contributors_summary: 8 contributors with work spanning compiler backends, type system, tooling, and infrastructure
repositories.contributors:
- [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) merged dissector pass for large executable linking ([#5146](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5146)) and arm64 AST library reorganization ([#5184](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5184)), opened 7 PRs for arm64 binary emitter including typed DSL ([#5193](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5193)), platform-independent JIT ([#5186](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5186)), improved typing ([#5185](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5185)), logical immediate refactoring ([#5192](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5192)), owee extensions ([#5188](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5188)), and dissector fixes ([#5191](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5191))
- [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) merged ocamlformat preparation changes ([#5181](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5181), [#5189](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5189)), opened ocamlformat upgrade PR ([#5180](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5180)) and dissector test fix ([#5195](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5195))
- [Zesen Qian](https://github.com/riaqn) opened PRs for modality hints integration ([#5183](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5183)) and explicit val_modalities handling ([#5190](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5190)) as part of modes system improvements
- [Ryan Tjoa](https://github.com/rtjoa) opened scannable axis modifier PR ([#5187](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5187)) addressing backwards compatibility, continuing work on or_null layout precision ([#5176](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5176), [#5178](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5178))
- [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) opened zero-alloc checker improvements preventing exception escapes ([#5179](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5179)) and synchronizing destruction point checks ([#5182](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5182))
- [Jakub Bachurski](https://github.com/jbachurski) merged type inspection infrastructure for quotes ([#5090](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5090)), continuing quote disambiguation work ([#5094](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5094), [#5154](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5154))
- [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) merged debug tracking improvements for name mangling ([#5098](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5098))
- [Jacob Van Buren](https://github.com/jvanburen) opened Nix flake update for OCaml 5.4 ([#5194](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5194))

group_summaries.brief_summary: Documentation infrastructure and package ecosystem updates: 21 packages merged, DkML instructions removed, documentation generation issues resolved
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Cryptokit 1.21.1 adds elliptic curves; Neo4j client with TLS; ocaml.org improves scraping infrastructure
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Cryptokit 1.21.1** by [Xavier Leroy](https://github.com/xavierleroy) adds Paillier homomorphic public-key encryption, elliptic-curve cryptography (ECDSA, ECDH), SHA512/256 and SHA512/224 hash functions, and key derivation functions; introduces breaking change with distinct RSA types for public/private keys ([ocaml/opam-repository#29162](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29162))
- **neo4j_bolt 0.3.0** by [Jeong-Sik Yun](https://github.com/jeong-sik) introduces TLS/SSL support with `bolt+s://`, `bolts://`, and `bolt+ssc://` URI schemes, plus URI-based connection configuration ([ocaml/opam-repository#29175](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29175))
- **shakuhachi 0.1.0** by [@EruEri](https://github.com/EruEri) provides music collection management and tagging capabilities ([ocaml/opam-repository#29136](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29136))
- **polymarket 0.2.0** by [Richard Haut](https://github.com/Haut) offers OCaml client for Polymarket prediction market API ([ocaml/opam-repository#29164](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29164))
- **intel_hex 0.1** by [Михаил](https://github.com/dx3mod) provides Intel HEX file manipulation for embedded systems ([ocaml/opam-repository#29180](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29180))
- **restricted 1.1** by [@stopusingghpls](https://github.com/stopusingghpls) enables restricting system operations and filesystem view, implementing OpenBSD-style security controls ([ocaml/opam-repository#29182](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29182))
- **reason-react-day-picker 0.1** by [Brian Kaplan](https://github.com/brianwk) adds Melange bindings for react-day-picker in ReasonML ([ocaml/opam-repository#29172](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29172))
- **raylib-callbacks 1.6.0** by [Tobias Mock](https://github.com/tjammer) introduces callback APIs for raylib with ctypes-foreign dependency, exposing ModelAnimation.t name field ([ocaml/opam-repository#29008](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29008))
- **ocamlformat-mlx 0.28.1.1** by [@mlx-automation](https://github.com/mlx-automation) updates Odoc parser to 3.0, adds letop-punning option and unnamed functor parameter support, sets OCaml 5.4 as default version ([ocaml/opam-repository#29169](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29169))
- **jupyter 3.0.1** by [Eugene Lykhovyd](https://github.com/zhelih) brings OCaml 5 support with legitimate maintainer handover from akabe ([ocaml/opam-repository#29142](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29142))
- **rpclib 10.0.0** by [Pau Ruiz Safont](https://github.com/psafont) adds Python 3 support, drops Python 2, removes deprecated rpc virtual package, and makes rpclib-async OCaml 5.3+ only while other libraries support 4.14+ ([ocaml/opam-repository#29075](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29075))
- **simple_httpd 1.0** by [Christophe Raffalli](https://github.com/craff) fixes bugs related to bytecode and 32-bit architectures, reaching first stable release ([ocaml/opam-repository#29154](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29154))
- **menhir-lsp 0.1.2** by [@dalps](https://github.com/dalps) fixes completion entries not showing due to special characters, reduces verbose document symbols, and improves documentation messages ([ocaml/opam-repository#29151](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29151))
- **reason-react 0.17.0** by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) upgrades ppxlib lower bound to 0.36 ([ocaml/opam-repository#29132](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29132))
- **Windows installation documentation** streamlined by removing deprecated DkML instructions following its sunsetting announcement, simplifying the Windows setup guide to focus on opam, Docker, and WSL2 ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3425](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3425))
- **HTTP client improvements** for scraping infrastructure including User-Agent header added to prevent blocking and optional random delay parameter to avoid rate limiting ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3434](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3434), [ocaml/ocaml.org#3435](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3435))
- **YouTube scraping enhancements** with randomized source processing order and configurable delay (up to 180 seconds) between requests to prevent blocking ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3435](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3435))
group_summaries.activity_summary: Eight new PRs in opam-repository addressing FFmpeg, POSIX, LLVM; dependency constraints and platform compatibility work; tutorial i18n ongoing
group_summaries.activity:
- **Eight new PRs opened** in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) include FFmpeg 1.2.8 bindings ([ocaml/opam-repository#29163](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29163)) by [Romain Beauxis](https://github.com/toots), POSIX 4.0.0 with 14 packages ([ocaml/opam-repository#29165](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29165)) by [Romain Beauxis](https://github.com/toots) iterating on FreeBSD compatibility, simple_httpd 1.0.1 ([ocaml/opam-repository#29174](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29174)) by [Christophe Raffalli](https://github.com/craff), LLVM 20 and 21 ([ocaml/opam-repository#29110](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29110)) by [Alan](https://github.com/alan-j-hu), metadata 0.3.2 ([ocaml/opam-repository#29183](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29183)) by [Romain Beauxis](https://github.com/toots), rizzo 0.3.0 FRP library ([ocaml/opam-repository#29181](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29181)) by [@tjobi](https://github.com/tjobi) fixing heap garbage collection bug, ortools 9.14.0 ([ocaml/opam-repository#29159](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29159)) by [Timothy Bourke](https://github.com/tbrk), and memcpy 0.3.0 ([ocaml/opam-repository#29144](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29144)) by [Jeremy Yallop](https://github.com/yallop) addressing Windows CI failures
- **Dependency constraint management** in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) saw extensive work with [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) adding missing ppxlib upper bounds in reason-react-ppx 0.13.0 and 0.14.0 ([ocaml/opam-repository#29177](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29177)), [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) adding more reason-react-ppx upper bounds ([ocaml/opam-repository#29178](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29178)) and constraining gapi-ocaml to cryptokit < 1.21 ([ocaml/opam-repository#29168](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29168)) due to breaking RSA type changes, and [Raphaël Proust](https://github.com/raphael-proust) fixing otel-cohttp-lwt compatibility with cohttp 6.2.0 ([ocaml/opam-repository#29157](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29157))
- **Platform-specific compatibility fixes** in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) delivered by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) adding zlib-dev dependency for conf-taglib_c.2 on Alpine ([ocaml/opam-repository#29161](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29161)), [Romain Beauxis](https://github.com/toots) addressing FreeBSD _PC_2_SYMLINKS issues in POSIX bindings, and [Raphaël Proust](https://github.com/raphael-proust) fixing kinetic-client.0.0.1 build failures ([ocaml/opam-repository#29156](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29156)) and cca packages ([ocaml/opam-repository#29155](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29155))
- **Withdrawn PRs** in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) include lwt 6.0.0 ([ocaml/opam-repository#29147](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29147)) by [Raphaël Proust](https://github.com/raphael-proust) due to cohttp-server-lwt-unix and inotify failures with plans to re-release, Cryptokit 1.21 ([ocaml/opam-repository#29148](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29148)) superseded by 1.21.1 to fix endian-dependent SHA512/224 bug on s390x, and POSIX 3.1.0 ([ocaml/opam-repository#29128](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29128)) withdrawn to implement larger changes resulting in 4.0.0 submission
- **Additional package updates** merged in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) include smtml 0.18.0 SMT solver frontend ([ocaml/opam-repository#29143](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29143)) by [@filipeom](https://github.com/filipeom), alice 0.3.0 ([ocaml/opam-repository#29145](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29145)) by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs), gapi-ocaml 0.4.8 ([ocaml/opam-repository#29176](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29176)) by [Alessandro Strada](https://github.com/astrada), and shellwords 1.0.0 ([ocaml/opam-repository#29126](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29126)) by [Daniel Fichtinger](https://github.com/ficd0)
- **Tutorial internationalization** in [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) continues as draft PR by [mt_caret](https://github.com/mt-caret) with initial framework for I18n affecting 77 files ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3238](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3238))
- **Automated content updates** merged throughout the week in [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) including OCaml Weekly News from December 30 and a blog post about multi-domain OCaml on Raspberry Pi Pico 2 microcontroller ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3439](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3439), [ocaml/ocaml.org#3438](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3438), [ocaml/ocaml.org#3436](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3436), [ocaml/ocaml.org#3431](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3431))
- **Workflow dependency updates** in [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) with GitHub Actions peter-evans/create-pull-request bumped from version 7 to 8 for Node 24 support ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3418](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3418))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- **Package ecosystem activity** in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) with 21 packages merged, spanning cryptography (Cryptokit 1.21.1 [ocaml/opam-repository#29162](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29162)), database clients (neo4j_bolt [ocaml/opam-repository#29175](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29175)), embedded systems (intel_hex [ocaml/opam-repository#29180](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29180)), music management (shakuhachi [ocaml/opam-repository#29136](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29136)), and security controls (restricted [ocaml/opam-repository#29182](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29182))
- **Documentation infrastructure improvements** across both repositories with [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) enhancing HTTP scraping reliability ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3434](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3434), [ocaml/ocaml.org#3435](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3435)) and addressing documentation generation failures caused by opam 2.5.0 compatibility issues ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3437))
- **Platform compatibility focus** in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) addressing Alpine/musl, FreeBSD, Windows, and s390x issues through targeted fixes and dependency updates ([ocaml/opam-repository#29161](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29161), [ocaml/opam-repository#29165](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29165), [ocaml/opam-repository#29158](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29158), [ocaml/opam-repository#29148](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29148))
- **Ecosystem coordination** demonstrated through careful management of breaking changes in Cryptokit ([ocaml/opam-repository#29162](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29162)) requiring gapi-ocaml constraint updates ([ocaml/opam-repository#29168](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29168)), and lwt 6.0.0 withdrawal ([ocaml/opam-repository#29147](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29147)) to address downstream failures
- **OCaml 5.x adoption** continuing with jupyter 3.0.1 ([ocaml/opam-repository#29142](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29142)), rpclib-async 10.0.0 requiring OCaml 5.3+ ([ocaml/opam-repository#29075](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29075)), and ocamlformat-mlx 0.28.1.1 setting OCaml 5.4 as default ([ocaml/opam-repository#29169](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29169))
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **Documentation generation failures** affecting packages in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) identified and resolved in [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) where [Julien Debon](https://github.com/sir4ur0n) reported missing documentation for QCheck 0.90/0.91 and other packages published since late November, with [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) investigating and identifying root cause as `OpamStd.String.starts_with` removal in opam 2.5.0 breaking the opamh tool used by voodoo documentation builder ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3437), [ocaml/opam-repository#29149](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29149))
- **Cross-repository contributor activity** with [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) contributing dependency constraint fixes to [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) ([ocaml/opam-repository#29177](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29177), [ocaml/opam-repository#29161](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29161)) while investigating documentation build failures in [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3437))
- **Issue routing** demonstrated when [Julien Debon](https://github.com/sir4ur0n) initially reported QCheck documentation missing in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) ([ocaml/opam-repository#29149](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29149)) and was redirected to [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) where the infrastructure issue was tracked and resolved ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3437))
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **CI testing philosophy** sparked debate in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) where [Romain Beauxis](https://github.com/toots) requested stopping `dune runtest` in opam-repo CI, arguing it creates anti-patterns where maintainers avoid dune testing framework; [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) countered that ecosystem-level integration tests catch regressions constantly and provide reverse dependency validation; [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) proposed standardizing test aliases in dune for different test types (unit, network/storage, end-to-end, benchmarks, fuzztests) as part of a three-tiered approach ([ocaml/opam-repository#29166](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29166))
- **Archiving policy clarification** requested in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) by [Martin Jambon](https://github.com/mjambon) about defining "archiving" and "maintaining" in x-maintenance-intent field; [@filipeom](https://github.com/filipeom) explained that archiving means moved to opam-repository-archive and no longer available through default remote, with criteria requiring package must be buildable, maintained, or depended upon ([ocaml/opam-repository#29106](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29106))
- **Documentation toolchain maintenance** highlighted by systematic failures in [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) documentation generation for recent package releases, revealing dependency on external tools that broke with opam 2.5.0 release; [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) identified the root cause and opened fix PR in upstream repository ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3437))
- **Windows CI behavior** issue raised in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) by [Raphaël Proust](https://github.com/raphael-proust) noting Windows actions build avoid-version packages unlike occurent-based CI ([ocaml/opam-repository#29158](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29158))
- **FreeBSD conf-mesa breakage** reported in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) by [Tobias Mock](https://github.com/tjammer) where conf-mesa.1 fails on FreeBSD with pkg-config gl errors, though it worked on FreeBSD 12 ([ocaml/opam-repository#29152](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29152))
- **Maintainer transition discussion** around jupyter 3.0.1 in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) demonstrated proper handover process from akabe to [Eugene Lykhovyd](https://github.com/zhelih), providing model for legitimate maintainer transitions ([ocaml/opam-repository#29142](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29142))
- **Devcontainer build issues** discussed in [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) by [Sacha Ayoun](https://github.com/giltho) regarding outdated Dockerfile leading to incompatible versions of lsp and yojson libraries, with ongoing investigation into why this doesn't affect CI or other developers ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3304](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3304))
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **OCaml 5.x adoption accelerating** in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) with jupyter 3.0.1 adding OCaml 5 support ([ocaml/opam-repository#29142](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29142)), rpclib-async 10.0.0 requiring OCaml 5.3+ ([ocaml/opam-repository#29075](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29075)), and ocamlformat-mlx 0.28.1.1 setting OCaml 5.4 as default version ([ocaml/opam-repository#29169](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29169))
- **Breaking changes managed carefully** through ecosystem coordination, demonstrated in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) by Cryptokit 1.21.1 RSA type split ([ocaml/opam-repository#29162](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29162)) requiring gapi-ocaml constraint update ([ocaml/opam-repository#29168](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29168)), and lwt 6.0.0 withdrawal ([ocaml/opam-repository#29147](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29147)) to rework socket option changes that caused cohttp and inotify failures
- **Platform-specific compatibility** receiving attention across Alpine/musl with zlib dependency fixes ([ocaml/opam-repository#29161](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29161)), FreeBSD with _PC_2_SYMLINKS issues ([ocaml/opam-repository#29165](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29165)) and conf-mesa breakage ([ocaml/opam-repository#29152](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29152)), Windows CI challenges with avoid-version packages ([ocaml/opam-repository#29158](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29158)) and memcpy failures ([ocaml/opam-repository#29144](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29144)), and s390x endianness in Cryptokit ([ocaml/opam-repository#29148](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29148))
- **Ecosystem diversity expanding** with new packages spanning embedded systems (intel_hex [ocaml/opam-repository#29180](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29180)), database clients (neo4j_bolt [ocaml/opam-repository#29175](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29175)), music management (shakuhachi [ocaml/opam-repository#29136](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29136)), prediction markets (polymarket [ocaml/opam-repository#29164](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29164)), and security (restricted [ocaml/opam-repository#29182](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29182))
- **Test infrastructure evolving** with discussion around separating unit tests from integration tests ([ocaml/opam-repository#29166](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29166)), proposal for standardized dune test aliases, and decisions to disable tests in POSIX 4.0.0 ([ocaml/opam-repository#29165](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29165)) compared to 3.1.0 ([ocaml/opam-repository#29128](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29128))
- **Dependency constraint precision improving** in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) through proactive upper bound additions for ppxlib in reason-react-ppx ([ocaml/opam-repository#29177](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29177), [ocaml/opam-repository#29178](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29178)), cryptokit in gapi-ocaml ([ocaml/opam-repository#29168](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29168)), and cohttp in otel-cohttp-lwt ([ocaml/opam-repository#29157](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29157))
- **Infrastructure robustness** focus in [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) with improvements to HTTP scraping tools to handle rate limiting and blocking through User-Agent headers, randomization, and delays preventing service disruptions ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3434](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3434), [ocaml/ocaml.org#3435](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3435))
- **Platform simplification** evident in [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) with removal of DkML installation instructions, consolidating Windows installation options following the sunsetting of that distribution ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3425](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3425))

group_summaries.brief_summary: Highly active week with 110 PRs merged in Dune resolving long-standing include_subdirs issues and advancing tracing
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Dynamic modules expansion, enhanced tracing with follow mode, cram test timing, package enabled_if support
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Dynamic `(modules ..)` expansion** for parser generators (ocamllex, ocamlyacc, menhir) in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) supporting special forms like `(:include ..)` and `%{read-lines:..}` by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) ([ocaml/dune#13105](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13105), [ocaml/dune#13135](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13135), [ocaml/dune#13157](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13157))
- **Sandboxed ocamllex and ocamlyacc** actions in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) for improved build isolation ([ocaml/dune#13098](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13098))
- **Cram test command timing** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) providing performance metrics for every command executed in cram tests by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) ([ocaml/dune#13092](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13092))
- **Trace follow mode** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) with `$ dune trace cat --follow` enabling real-time trace monitoring by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) ([ocaml/dune#13133](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13133))
- **Signal tracing events** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) added to trace output for debugging signal handling ([ocaml/dune#13193](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13193))
- **Canonical s-expression trace format** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) improving performance and consistency, supporting `--chrome-trace` for perfetto and `--sexp` for interactive usage ([ocaml/dune#13059](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13059))
- **Package-level `enabled_if` field** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) dune-project files allowing conditional package masking with conversion to opam `available` expressions (unreleased, requires Dune 3.22+) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) ([ocaml/dune#12905](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12905))
- Fixed **menhir parser compilation** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) in subdirectories with `(include_subdirs qualified)` ([ocaml/dune#13118](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13118), fixes [ocaml/dune#11119](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11119))
- Fixed **`(select ..)` field handling** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) with `(include_subdirs ..)` parsing paths relative to module group root ([ocaml/dune#13175](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13175), fixes [ocaml/dune#4383](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/4383), [ocaml/dune#12450](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12450))
- Fixed **delayed module path evaluation** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) for include_subdirs qualified ([ocaml/dune#13156](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13156), fixes [ocaml/dune#7628](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/7628), [ocaml/dune#7605](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/7605))
- Improved **include_subdirs documentation** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) with comprehensive usage examples and troubleshooting ([ocaml/dune#13200](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13200))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) led group activity with 110 PRs merged, resolving multiple long-standing issues (5+ years old) related to `include_subdirs qualified` functionality ([ocaml/dune#4381](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/4381), [ocaml/dune#4383](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/4383), [ocaml/dune#7628](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/7628), [ocaml/dune#11119](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11119), [ocaml/dune#12450](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12450))
- Major infrastructure work in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) focused on observability with comprehensive tracing enhancements including real-time monitoring, performance analysis tools, and command timing ([ocaml/dune#13059](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13059), [ocaml/dune#13092](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13092), [ocaml/dune#13116](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13116), [ocaml/dune#13133](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13133), [ocaml/dune#13193](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13193), [ocaml/dune#13203](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13203))
- Package management evolution in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) and [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) with vendoring utility development, improved git pinning, and license field support ([ocaml/dune#13097](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13097), [ocaml/dune#13176](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13176), [ocaml/opam#6841](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6841))
- Test infrastructure improvements across [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) (bash integration and cram test enhancements) and [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) (systematic bug reproduction test cases) ([ocaml/dune#13132](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13132), [ocaml/dune#13137](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13137), [ocaml/merlin#2020](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2020), [ocaml/merlin#2021](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2021), [ocaml/merlin#2022](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2022))
- [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) received automated Nix flake dependency updates ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1437))
- No activity recorded for [ocaml/ocamlfind](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind), [ocaml/odoc](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc), [ocaml/opam-file-format](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-file-format), [ocaml-dune/spawn](https://github.com/ocaml-dune/spawn), and [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) during this week
group_summaries.activity_summary: Scheduler refactoring, bash integration completion, and cross-platform testing attention alongside active code reviews
group_summaries.activity:
- **Include_subdirs qualified maturity** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) with 57 PRs merged by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) implementing comprehensive improvements including dynamic module expansion for parser generators, select field fixes, module path evaluation improvements, and extensive test coverage ([ocaml/dune#13105](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13105), [ocaml/dune#13118](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13118), [ocaml/dune#13135](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13135), [ocaml/dune#13156](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13156), [ocaml/dune#13157](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13157), [ocaml/dune#13160](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13160), [ocaml/dune#13167](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13167), [ocaml/dune#13175](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13175), [ocaml/dune#13185](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13185), [ocaml/dune#13187](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13187), [ocaml/dune#13189](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13189), [ocaml/dune#13195](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13195), [ocaml/dune#13198](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13198))
- **Dune scheduler refactoring** by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) extracting scheduler into dedicated library with nine modularization PRs improving code organization ([ocaml/dune#13191](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13191), [ocaml/dune#13207](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13207), [ocaml/dune#13208](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13208), [ocaml/dune#13209](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13209), [ocaml/dune#13210](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13210), [ocaml/dune#13211](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13211), [ocaml/dune#13212](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13212), [ocaml/dune#13213](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13213), [ocaml/dune#13214](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13214))
- **Tracing infrastructure enhancements** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) with atomic event writing ([ocaml/dune#13116](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13116)), thread safety improvements ([ocaml/dune#13151](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13151)), signal tracking ([ocaml/dune#13193](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13193)), cram test event naming ([ocaml/dune#13197](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13197)), and jq function for analyzing slow commands ([ocaml/dune#13203](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13203))
- **Cram test bash integration** completed in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) with bash shell support ([ocaml/dune#13137](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13137)), safety options including errexit and pipefail ([ocaml/dune#13132](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13132)), undefined variable detection ([ocaml/dune#13161](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13161)), bash script syntax checking ([ocaml/dune#13186](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13186)), improved unreachable output extraction ([ocaml/dune#13164](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13164)), and evaluation fixes ([ocaml/dune#13150](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13150))
- **Package management work** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) with nested dune executable resolution fix closing 2-year-old issue ([ocaml/dune#12902](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12902), fixes [ocaml/dune#10019](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/10019)), pinning function renaming for clarity ([ocaml/dune#13178](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13178)), pin stanza behavior documentation ([ocaml/dune#13106](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13106), [ocaml/dune#13126](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13126), [ocaml/dune#13127](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13127)), and active discussions on git pinning ([ocaml/dune#13176](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13176)) and vendoring utility ([ocaml/dune#13097](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13097))
- **Test coverage expansion** in [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) with [Charlène_Gros](https://github.com/Lucccyo) from Tarides opening four reproduction test case PRs for historical bug reports ([ocaml/merlin#2020](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2020) for [ocaml/merlin#1987](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1987), [ocaml/merlin#2021](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2021) for [ocaml/merlin#1763](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1763), [ocaml/merlin#2022](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2022) for [ocaml/merlin#1214](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1214), [ocaml/merlin#2017](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2017) for [ocaml/merlin#1980](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1980))
- **License field support** in [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) with [Raphaël Proust](https://github.com/raphael-proust) opening PR to add `license` as field for `opam list` command, receiving code review feedback from [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) requesting use of `assoc_opt` and tests ([ocaml/opam#6841](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6841))
- Ten **new PRs opened** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) including OCaml vendoring utility by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) ([ocaml/dune#13097](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13097)), cross-compilation `--target-exec` implementation by [Romain Beauxis](https://github.com/toots) ([ocaml/dune#13112](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13112)), git repository pinning improvements by [Marek Kubica](https://github.com/Leonidas-from-XIV) ([ocaml/dune#13176](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13176)), dune init src directory default by [Etienne](https://github.com/maiste) ([ocaml/dune#13192](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13192)), vendoring test for data-only directories by [Sudha Parimala](https://github.com/Sudha247) ([ocaml/dune#13129](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13129)), dune-site linkall warning by [Raphaël Proust](https://github.com/raphael-proust) ([ocaml/dune#13109](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13109)), CI opam dependency caching by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) ([ocaml/dune#13177](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13177)), and trace commands enhancement by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) ([ocaml/dune#13183](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13183))
- **CI and test infrastructure** improvements in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) including multi-repo-build depext auto-installation ([ocaml/dune#13111](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13111)), display configuration ([ocaml/dune#13124](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13124)), configurable steps ([ocaml/dune#13125](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13125)), unique cache prefix enforcement ([ocaml/dune#13091](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13091)), opam cache optimization ([ocaml/dune#13115](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13115)), building `@install` instead of `@all` in tests ([ocaml/dune#13206](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13206)), and removing `--display short` from odoc tests ([ocaml/dune#13204](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13204))
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **Merlin dependency update** in [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) with automated Nix flake lock file update PR updating merlin5_3 from June to December 2025 and nixpkgs dependencies ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1437))
- **Package management discussions** spanning [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) and [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) with work on vendoring utility ([ocaml/dune#13097](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13097)), git pinning improvements ([ocaml/dune#13176](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13176)), and opam list license field support ([ocaml/opam#6841](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6841)) indicating ongoing coordination on package metadata and workflow improvements
- **Cross-platform testing** attention in [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) with Windows CI path handling discussion ([ocaml/merlin#2017](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2017)) addressing differences between Linux and Windows test output that may affect other OCaml tools
- **Test infrastructure patterns** emerging across [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) and [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) with both repositories expanding test coverage through systematic approaches - Dune's bash integration for cram tests ([ocaml/dune#13132](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13132), [ocaml/dune#13137](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13137)) and Merlin's historical bug reproduction tests ([ocaml/merlin#2020](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2020), [ocaml/merlin#2021](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2021), [ocaml/merlin#2022](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2022))
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Executable organization documentation** debate in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) with 29 comments by [@jrfondren](https://github.com/jrfondren) discussing dune init defaults and project layout conventions, leading to good first issue for howto guide ([ocaml/dune#13142](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13142), [ocaml/dune#13181](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13181))
- **Vendoring utility** design discussions in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) with 20 comments by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) covering implementation approach for OCaml package vendoring ([ocaml/dune#13097](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13097))
- **Git repository pinning** enhancement in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) with 18 comments by [Marek Kubica](https://github.com/Leonidas-from-XIV) proposing git_repo usage for package pinning ([ocaml/dune#13176](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13176))
- **Select field fix** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) with 18 comments by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) addressing path handling with include_subdirs through thorough review process ([ocaml/dune#13175](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13175))
- **Tag visibility improvements** in [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) with detailed issue by [@jrfondren](https://github.com/jrfondren) analyzing tag usage across 729 singleton tags and proposing tag cloud, dedicated search, and columns option for `opam list` ([ocaml/opam#6842](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6842))
- **Windows CI path handling** discussion in [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) where [Charlène_Gros](https://github.com/Lucccyo) seeks input from [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) and [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw) on test output normalization for cross-platform compatibility ([ocaml/merlin#2017](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2017))
- **Trace atomic writes** implementation in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) with 14 comments by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) covering technical details of event writing improvements ([ocaml/dune#13116](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13116))
- **Trace follow mode** feature in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) with 12 comments by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) regarding real-time trace monitoring capabilities ([ocaml/dune#13133](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13133))
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Technical debt reduction** with resolution of multiple historical issues spanning 5-7 years in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) including include_subdirs bugs ([ocaml/dune#4381](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/4381), [ocaml/dune#4383](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/4383), [ocaml/dune#7628](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/7628)) and runtest module selection ([ocaml/dune#870](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/870) via [ocaml/dune#13064](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13064))
- **Observability focus** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) with comprehensive tracing enhancements including performance analysis tools, real-time monitoring, and command timing providing deeper build insights ([ocaml/dune#13059](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13059), [ocaml/dune#13092](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13092), [ocaml/dune#13116](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13116), [ocaml/dune#13133](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13133), [ocaml/dune#13193](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13193), [ocaml/dune#13203](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13203))
- **Package management modernization** across [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) and [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) with vendoring utility development, improved git pinning, license field support, and tag visibility improvements ([ocaml/dune#13097](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13097), [ocaml/dune#13176](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13176), [ocaml/opam#6841](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6841), [ocaml/opam#6842](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6842))
- **Code health initiatives** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) with scheduler modularization into dedicated library improving maintainability ([ocaml/dune#13191](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13191), [ocaml/dune#13207](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13207) through [ocaml/dune#13214](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13214))
- **Cross-platform testing** attention in [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) addressing Windows CI path handling differences requiring platform-specific test output normalization ([ocaml/merlin#2017](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2017))
- **Test infrastructure improvements** across multiple repositories with [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) establishing comprehensive bash integration for cram tests ([ocaml/dune#13132](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13132), [ocaml/dune#13137](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13137), [ocaml/dune#13186](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13186)) and [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) systematically adding reproduction tests for historical bugs ([ocaml/merlin#2020](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2020), [ocaml/merlin#2021](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2021), [ocaml/merlin#2022](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2022))

group_summaries.brief_summary: Dissector pass merged for large executables, arm64 platform support advancing, modes system refinements continuing
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Dissector pass for 2GB+ executables, debug tracking improvements, type inspection infrastructure, arm64 AST library
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Dissector pass** for linking large executables (>2GB) using small code model without text section changes, enabled via `-dissector` flag with partition size control via `-dissector-partition-size` and debug flags `-ddissector`, `-ddissector-sizes`, `-ddissector-verbose`, `-ddissector-partitions`, and `-ddissector-inputs` by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5146](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5146)
- **Debug tracking improvements** for name mangling with new `enter_anonymous_module` function and location tracking in `enter_anonymous_function` by [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5098](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5098)
- **Type inspection infrastructure** with `Texp_inspected_type` and `Tpat_inspected_type` nodes for passing disambiguation information in quotes by [Jakub Bachurski](https://github.com/jbachurski) in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5090](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5090)
- **Arm64 AST reorganization** moving arm64 AST into dedicated library in `backend/arm64/ast/` to support upcoming binary emitter by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5184](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5184)
- **OCamlformat preparation** with formatting fixes to support upgrade to version 0.28.1 by [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5181](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5181) and [oxcaml/oxcaml#5189](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5189)
group_summaries.group_overview:
- All activity concentrated in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) with 17 new PRs opened and 5 PRs merged this week
- [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) merged dissector pass enabling large executable linking via [oxcaml/oxcaml#5146](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5146) and opened 7 PRs advancing arm64 binary emitter infrastructure
- [Zesen Qian](https://github.com/riaqn) and [Ryan Tjoa](https://github.com/rtjoa) continued modes system refinements with PRs for modality hints, scannable axes, and or_null precision
- [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) prepared for OCaml 5.4 upgrade with ocamlformat version bump via [oxcaml/oxcaml#5180](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5180)
- No activity in oxcaml/opam-repository, oxcaml/merlin, oxcaml/js_of_ocaml, or janestreet/opam-repository during this week
group_summaries.activity_summary: 17 new PRs opened including arm64 DSL, modes improvements, zero-alloc checker fixes, and tooling updates
group_summaries.activity:
- **Arm64 binary emitter work** progressing with infrastructure improvements including typed DSL rewrite in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5193](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5193), improved label/symbol typing in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5185](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5185), extra owee functionality in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5188](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5188), and binary emitter itself in draft form via [oxcaml/oxcaml#5177](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5177) by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell)
- **Modes system refinements** with [Zesen Qian](https://github.com/riaqn) working on modality hints in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5183](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5183), explicit val_modalities application in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5190](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5190), and module mode hints in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5034](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5034), while [Ryan Tjoa](https://github.com/rtjoa) addresses scannable axes behavior in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5187](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5187) and [oxcaml/oxcaml#5169](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5169), and or_null layout precision in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5176](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5176) and [oxcaml/oxcaml#5178](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5178)
- **Zero-alloc checker improvements** by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) preventing Widen exception escapes in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5179](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5179) and synchronizing destruction point checks in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5182](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5182)
- **Dissector refinements** following merge with stack overflow fix in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5191](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5191) and test simplification in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5195](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5195) by [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) and [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell)
- **Metaprogramming features** advancing with quote disambiguation work by [Jakub Bachurski](https://github.com/jbachurski) for records/variants in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5094](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5094) and polymorphic applications in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5154](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5154)
- **OCaml 5.4 upgrade** preparations continuing by [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) with ocamlformat version bump in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5180](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5180) and Nix flake update by [Jacob Van Buren](https://github.com/jvanburen) in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5194](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5194) as part of broader upgrade effort tracked in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5036](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5036)
- **Platform-independent JIT support** being added to ocaml-jit by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5186](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5186) to enable metaprogramming support alongside arm64 work
- **Logical immediate refactoring** for arm64 improving bitwise immediate encoding by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5192](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5192)
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Ikinds representation** discussion by [@julesjacobs](https://github.com/julesjacobs) exploring minus24 encoding with over 160 comments addressing layout computation, mutual recursion handling, and integration strategy in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5159](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5159)
- **Arm64 binary emitter architecture** refinement by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) discussing verification flags, improved typing for labels/symbols, and integration with ocaml-jit for metaprogramming support in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5177](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5177)
- **Scannable axes semantics** debate between [Ryan Tjoa](https://github.com/rtjoa) and reviewers regarding backwards compatibility for `mod` syntax behavior with non_float and nullability modifiers, balancing immediate needs against future ppx_template improvements in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5187](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5187)
- **Or_null layout precision** technical discussion by [Ryan Tjoa](https://github.com/rtjoa) examining separability computation edge cases and dead code identification in type_jkind in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5178](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5178)
- **Preemption implementation** review by [Aspen Smith](https://github.com/glittershark) with detailed feedback on SSE register handling in garbage collection interface in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5136](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5136) and [oxcaml/oxcaml#4881](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4881)
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Arm64 platform maturation** with comprehensive work spanning typed DSL rewrite, binary emitter implementation, platform-independent JIT support, and improved label/symbol typing across 7+ PRs by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5193](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5193), [oxcaml/oxcaml#5192](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5192), [oxcaml/oxcaml#5191](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5191), [oxcaml/oxcaml#5188](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5188), [oxcaml/oxcaml#5186](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5186), [oxcaml/oxcaml#5185](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5185), [oxcaml/oxcaml#5184](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5184), and [oxcaml/oxcaml#5177](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5177)
- **Modes system refinement** through multiple coordinated PRs addressing modality hints, val_modalities application, scannable axes semantics, and or_null precision by [Zesen Qian](https://github.com/riaqn) and [Ryan Tjoa](https://github.com/rtjoa) in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5183](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5183), [oxcaml/oxcaml#5190](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5190), [oxcaml/oxcaml#5187](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5187), [oxcaml/oxcaml#5176](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5176), [oxcaml/oxcaml#5178](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5178), [oxcaml/oxcaml#5169](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5169), and [oxcaml/oxcaml#5034](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5034)
- **Tooling modernization** with OCaml 5.4 upgrade preparations including ocamlformat 0.28.1 bump and Nix flake updates in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5180](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5180), [oxcaml/oxcaml#5194](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5194), and [oxcaml/oxcaml#5036](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5036)
- **Metaprogramming infrastructure** development with type inspection framework and quote disambiguation features by [Jakub Bachurski](https://github.com/jbachurski) in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5090](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5090), [oxcaml/oxcaml#5094](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5094), and [oxcaml/oxcaml#5154](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5154)
- **Large-scale compilation support** with dissector pass enabling 2GB+ executables using small code model without recompilation by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5146](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5146)

weekly_summary.brief_summary: Focused oxcaml week with dissector pass merged, arm64 maturation, 110 Dune PRs merged resolving 5+ year old bugs, 21 ecosystem packages
weekly_summary.new_features_summary: Dissector pass for 2GB+ executables, dynamic modules, trace follow mode, cram timing, cryptokit elliptic curves, neo4j TLS
weekly_summary.new_features:
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Dissector pass** for linking large executables exceeding 2GB using small code model without text section changes, enabled via `-dissector` flag with partition size control via `-dissector-partition-size` and debug flags `-ddissector`, `-ddissector-sizes`, `-ddissector-verbose`, `-ddissector-partitions`, and `-ddissector-inputs` by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5146](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5146)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Debug tracking improvements** for name mangling with new `enter_anonymous_module` function and location tracking in `enter_anonymous_function` by [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5098](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5098)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Type inspection infrastructure** with `Texp_inspected_type` and `Tpat_inspected_type` nodes for passing disambiguation information in quotes by [Jakub Bachurski](https://github.com/jbachurski) in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5090](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5090)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Arm64 AST reorganization** moving arm64 AST into dedicated library in `backend/arm64/ast/` to support upcoming binary emitter by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5184](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5184)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **OCamlformat preparation** with formatting fixes to support upgrade to version 0.28.1 by [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) in [oxcaml/oxcaml#5181](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5181) and [oxcaml/oxcaml#5189](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5189)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Dynamic `(modules ..)` expansion** for parser generators (ocamllex, ocamlyacc, menhir) supporting special forms like `(:include ..)` and `%{read-lines:..}` by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) in [ocaml/dune#13105](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13105), [ocaml/dune#13135](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13135), [ocaml/dune#13157](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13157)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Sandboxed ocamllex and ocamlyacc** actions for improved build isolation in [ocaml/dune#13098](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13098)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Cram test command timing** providing performance metrics for every command executed in cram tests by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) in [ocaml/dune#13092](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13092)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Trace follow mode** with `$ dune trace cat --follow` enabling real-time trace monitoring by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) in [ocaml/dune#13133](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13133)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Signal tracing events** added to trace output for debugging signal handling in [ocaml/dune#13193](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13193)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Canonical s-expression trace format** improving performance and consistency, supporting `--chrome-trace` for perfetto and `--sexp` for interactive usage in [ocaml/dune#13059](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13059)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Package-level `enabled_if` field** in dune-project files allowing conditional package masking with conversion to opam `available` expressions (unreleased, requires Dune 3.22+) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) in [ocaml/dune#12905](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12905)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ Fixed **menhir parser compilation** in subdirectories with `(include_subdirs qualified)` in [ocaml/dune#13118](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13118), closing [ocaml/dune#11119](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11119) from 2024
- __RUMINANT:tools__ Fixed **`(select ..)` field handling** with `(include_subdirs ..)` parsing paths relative to module group root in [ocaml/dune#13175](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13175), closing [ocaml/dune#4383](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/4383) from 2019 and [ocaml/dune#12450](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12450)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ Fixed **delayed module path evaluation** for include_subdirs qualified in [ocaml/dune#13156](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13156), closing [ocaml/dune#7628](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/7628) and [ocaml/dune#7605](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/7605) from 2020
- __RUMINANT:tools__ Improved **include_subdirs documentation** with comprehensive usage examples and troubleshooting in [ocaml/dune#13200](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13200)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **Cryptokit 1.21.1** by [Xavier Leroy](https://github.com/xavierleroy) adds Paillier homomorphic public-key encryption, elliptic-curve cryptography (ECDSA, ECDH), SHA512/256 and SHA512/224 hash functions, and key derivation functions with breaking change introducing distinct RSA types for public/private keys in [ocaml/opam-repository#29162](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29162)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **neo4j_bolt 0.3.0** by [Jeong-Sik Yun](https://github.com/jeong-sik) introduces TLS/SSL support with `bolt+s://`, `bolts://`, and `bolt+ssc://` URI schemes, plus URI-based connection configuration in [ocaml/opam-repository#29175](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29175)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **shakuhachi 0.1.0** by [@EruEri](https://github.com/EruEri) provides music collection management and tagging capabilities in [ocaml/opam-repository#29136](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29136)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **polymarket 0.2.0** by [Richard Haut](https://github.com/Haut) offers OCaml client for Polymarket prediction market API in [ocaml/opam-repository#29164](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29164)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **intel_hex 0.1** by [Михаил](https://github.com/dx3mod) provides Intel HEX file manipulation for embedded systems in [ocaml/opam-repository#29180](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29180)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **restricted 1.1** by [@stopusingghpls](https://github.com/stopusingghpls) enables restricting system operations and filesystem view, implementing OpenBSD-style security controls in [ocaml/opam-repository#29182](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29182)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **reason-react-day-picker 0.1** by [Brian Kaplan](https://github.com/brianwk) adds Melange bindings for react-day-picker in ReasonML in [ocaml/opam-repository#29172](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29172)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **raylib-callbacks 1.6.0** by [Tobias Mock](https://github.com/tjammer) introduces callback APIs for raylib with ctypes-foreign dependency, exposing ModelAnimation.t name field in [ocaml/opam-repository#29008](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29008)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **ocamlformat-mlx 0.28.1.1** by [@mlx-automation](https://github.com/mlx-automation) updates Odoc parser to 3.0, adds letop-punning option and unnamed functor parameter support, sets OCaml 5.4 as default version in [ocaml/opam-repository#29169](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29169)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **jupyter 3.0.1** by [Eugene Lykhovyd](https://github.com/zhelih) brings OCaml 5 support with legitimate maintainer handover from akabe in [ocaml/opam-repository#29142](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29142)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **rpclib 10.0.0** by [Pau Ruiz Safont](https://github.com/psafont) adds Python 3 support, drops Python 2, removes deprecated rpc virtual package, and makes rpclib-async OCaml 5.3+ only while other libraries support 4.14+ in [ocaml/opam-repository#29075](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29075)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **simple_httpd 1.0** by [Christophe Raffalli](https://github.com/craff) fixes bugs related to bytecode and 32-bit architectures, reaching first stable release in [ocaml/opam-repository#29154](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29154)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **menhir-lsp 0.1.2** by [@dalps](https://github.com/dalps) fixes completion entries not showing due to special characters, reduces verbose document symbols, and improves documentation messages in [ocaml/opam-repository#29151](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29151)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **reason-react 0.17.0** by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) upgrades ppxlib lower bound to 0.36 in [ocaml/opam-repository#29132](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29132)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **Windows installation documentation** streamlined by removing deprecated DkML instructions following its sunsetting announcement in [ocaml/ocaml.org#3425](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3425)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **HTTP client improvements** for scraping infrastructure including User-Agent header added to prevent blocking and optional random delay parameter to avoid rate limiting in [ocaml/ocaml.org#3434](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3434) and [ocaml/ocaml.org#3435](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3435)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **YouTube scraping enhancements** with randomized source processing order and configurable delay (up to 180 seconds) between requests to prevent blocking in [ocaml/ocaml.org#3435](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3435)

tools: -**Dynamic `(modules ..)` expansion** for parser generators (ocamllex, ocamlyacc, menhir) supporting special forms like `(:include ..)` and `%{read-lines:..}` by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) in [ocaml/dune#13105](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13105), [ocaml/dune#13135](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13135), [ocaml/dune#13157](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13157)
-**Sandboxed ocamllex and ocamlyacc** actions for improved build isolation in [ocaml/dune#13098](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/13098)
